radiographic_examinations.findings: Single left adrenal pheochromocytoma. Evidence of capsular rupture.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: CT confirmed the presence of multiple nodules in the aortic bifurcation and the left iliac fossa 8 years after initial surgery.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Single left adrenal pheochromocytoma with evidence of capsular rupture.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: MIBG imaging revealed multiple uptake sites in the central abdominal region and left iliac fossa 8 years after initial surgery.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Single adrenal pheochromocytoma of 70 mm with evidence of capsular rupture.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: CT and 123I-MIBG detected multiple nodules in the retroperitoneum 6 years after primary resection.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Single adrenal pheochromocytoma of 70 mm with evidence of capsular rupture.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Detected multiple nodules in the retroperitoneum 6 years after primary resection.
CT demonstrated multiple nodules in the adrenal bed and adjacent structures 4 years after surgery.
Multiple nodules were noted in subsequent imaging 4 years later.

radiographic_examinations.findings: 25 mm pheochromocytoma in the left adrenal gland.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: CT revealed a 34 mm tumor mass within the left kidney pedicle and several adjacent nodules 2 years post-surgery.
Five months post-surgery, no evidence of tumor persistence; however, a 110 mm mass was found 16 years later.
Intense tracer uptake observed 16 years after initial surgery.
